data.title: Data Protector User Discussions
data.meta_description: Hi, a question related to HP Data Protector Manager v A.09.00... this week I replace a Backup guy. Have a quesion about moving scratch tapes to working Pool. I had
data.text:
Hi,

a question related to HP Data Protector Manager v A.09.00...

this week I replace a Backup guy. Have a quesion about moving scratch tapes to working Pool.

I had 3 min instructions so forgot one step that quickly put on paper (not my fault :) )

so, what I did:

1. found the tape with yesterday's back and removed it (was week 2)

2. inserted Tapes for a new week (Week 3 in my case)

The guy told me that he takes a photo of tapes before inserting them ... and then I should find them and move in DP Manager.

So what I could do ...

1. In HP DP Manager I moved the tape with yesterdays backup (that phisically removed) from working pool (Default LTO-Ultrium) to CS (it is Scratch pool).

2. Since I didn't take the photo of tapes that I inserted I decided to make it even simpler :)

(don't think that I have to have the tapes names before inserting them to the library (take a photo like instructed.)

In the scratch pool (SC) I see Expired with horisontal green tape icon. So for me it is a sign that those tapes could freely go to the working pool. This what I did: just moved them to working pool Default LTO Ultrium.

Could somebody confirm that I did right? (or what is my mistake if any...)

Thanks.
